intro: Thymelaea hirsuta var. polygalifolia, commonly known as the woolly thymelaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in shrubland or mountainous regions. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with branched stems and alternate leaves. The flowers appear in clusters and are followed by small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds.
